figure_1: The roles in the Bear-Guardian and Hunter Game.
figure_2: Units of emotional meaning in the Bear role.
figure_4: Units of emotional meaning in the Hunter role.
figure_3: Units of emotional meaning in the Guardian role.
figure_5: Itinerary of the emotional meanings in the three roles. The thickness of the lines corresponds to the frequency of comments. The thicker the lines, the more comments there are.
figure_6: Emotional itinerary in the chained roles. The thickness of the lines corresponds to the frequency of comments. The thicker the lines, the more comments there are.
figure_7: The intensity of positive and negative emotions in the Bear, Guardian, and Hunter roles.
figure_8: Orientation of emotional triads in the Bear role.
figure_9: Orientation of emotional triads in the Guardian role.
figure_10: Orientation of emotional triads in the Hunter role.
figure_11: Emotional itineraries (groups of association rules) based on the emotional meaning of the Bear associated with Motor Aggression by support, confidence and lift measures.
figure_12: The chained role changes network. Emotions and status/power motor interactions. The line represents the change of role. The dot corresponds to the role. The loop over the Hunter role shows that when a role change occurs, some players remain in the same role, as only one hunter changes to the Bear role.s
